com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.Creatable
      • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.Context
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLVersioned
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GL20Context

    public abstract class Context
extends Creatable
implements GLVersioned
    Represents an OpenGL context. Creating context must be done before any other OpenGL object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Context.BlendFunction
      An enum of the blending functions.

      An enum of the renderer capabilities.

      • setClearColor

        public abstract void setClearColor(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector4f color)
        Sets the renderer buffer clear color. This can be interpreted as the background color.
        Parameters:
        color - The clear color

      • clearCurrentBuffer

        public abstract void clearCurrentBuffer()
        Clears the currently bound buffer (either a frame buffer, or the front (screen) buffer if none are bound).

        public abstract void enableCapability(Context.Capability capability)

      • setDepthMask

        public abstract void setDepthMask(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables writing into the depth buffer.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Whether or not to write into the depth buffer.

      • setBlendingFunctions

        public void setBlendingFunctions(Context.BlendFunction source,
                                 Context.BlendFunction destination)
        Sets the blending functions for the source and destination buffers, for all buffers. Blending must be enabled with enableCapability(com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.Context.Capability).
        Parameters:
        source - The source function
        destination - The destination function

      • setBlendingFunctions

        public abstract void setBlendingFunctions(int bufferIndex,
                                          Context.BlendFunction source,
                                          Context.BlendFunction destination)
        Sets the blending functions for the source and destination buffer at the index. Blending must be enabled with enableCapability(com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.Context.Capability).

        Support for specifying the buffer index is only available in GL40.

        Parameters:
        bufferIndex - The index of the target buffer
        source - The source function
        destination - The destination function

      • setViewPort

        public abstract void setViewPort(Rectangle viewPort)
        Sets the render view port, which is the dimensions and position of the frame inside the window.
        Parameters:
        viewPort - The view port

      • readFrame

        public abstract ByteBuffer readFrame(Rectangle size,
                                     Texture.InternalFormat format)
        Reads the current frame pixels and returns it as a byte buffer of the desired format. The size of the returned image data is the same as the current window dimensions.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the frame to read
        format - The image format to return
        Returns:
        The byte buffer containing the pixel data, according to the provided format

      • isWindowCloseRequested

        public abstract boolean isWindowCloseRequested()
        Returns true if an external process (such as the user) is requesting for the window to be closed. This value is reset once this method has been called.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the window is being requested to close

      • uploadUniforms

        public void uploadUniforms(Program program)
        Uploads the renderer uniforms to the desired program.
        Parameters:
        program - The program to upload to

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(Camera camera)
        Sets the render camera. Will be use for all subsequent render calls, until changed again.
        Parameters:
        camera - The camera to use

      • getCamera

        public Camera getCamera()
        Returns the current renderer camera.
        Returns:
        The camera

      • setMSAA

        public void setMSAA(int value)
        Sets the MSAA value. Must be greater or equal to zero. Zero means no MSAA.
        Parameters:
        value - The MSAA value, greater or equal to zero

      • getUniforms

        public UniformHolder getUniforms()
        Returns the Uniforms for this renderer
        Returns:
        The renderer uniforms
